intro: Roscoea alpina, commonly known as the alpine roscoea, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers, and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces striking, orange-red inflorescences with showy, tubular flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows at high elevations. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
